channel.title: Comments for page "Perfect Poker"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Perfect Poker"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I believe king omaha is a puzzle boss, I lost to him twice and both times he started the game with 4 kings. This is also in line with the other games.
The question is really which hand one should aim at for winning, I am guessing royal flush

EDIT: Lost several more times, he always starts with 4 kings, my deck seems random. Royal flush is impossible, but any straightflush or 4 aces will beat it. it seems like it is a matter of luck actually getting that rather than a preset deck (that, or there might be multiple preset decks)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Don't know if we're gonna catalog this, but the start of game text for a crazy game is:

You feel a presence at the table across from you. Meeting their gaze, you draw your opening hand..

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Sorry about the double-post, last post was while I wasn't logged in.

King Omaha definitely starts with all 4 Kings and the Ace of Spades. The last card in the deck seems to be the Ace of Hearts.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Every time I have played against him, King Omaha has started with all 4 Kings. I think he has also had an Ace, which he immediately discards. This means you HAVE to go for a straight flush to beat him.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Should we include the cards available at each step? First is 2/4/6/8 of clubs and diamonds, beating Potatoes unlocks 3/5/6/7 of hearts. Not sure how useful it would be, but I figure I'd jot it down anyways.
